page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: This area is rural and has a very small population. Even its one settlement, Wennington, has only about 20 people. The main living of the population is from farming. The land is good pasture land for grazing dairy cattle and sheep. Several of the farms are quite large and have been established for many generations. Apart from farming there is little employment, so that non-farmers tend to be professional people, generally working in Lancaster, about 10 miles away. The area is bereft of amenities - indeed there is not even a shop within it. Much shopping is done therefore in High Bentham, about 4 miles east of Wennington, but the majority of shopping is done in Lancaster, which is also the major centre of entertainment in the area.
